description: From Middle English concelen, from Old French conceler (“hide, disguise”), from Latin concelāre, infinitive of concelō (“carefully disguise”).

verbs.description: conceal (third-person singular simple present conceals, present participle concealing, simple past and past participle concealed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To hide something from view or from public knowledge, to try to keep something secret.
examples: He tried to conceal the truth about his health.
